benchmark_details.name: MASSW (Multi-Aspect Summarization of Scientific Workflows)
benchmark_details.overview: MASSW is a comprehensive text dataset focused on Multi-Aspect Summarization of Scientific Workflows, including structured summaries extracted from over 152,000 peer-reviewed publications. The dataset is designed to enable various machine-learning tasks that predict and recommend steps in scientific research workflows.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a structured dataset that facilitates the exploration and optimization of scientific workflows through AI-assisted methods.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to AI-related computer science publications and may not generalize across other domains.

data.source: Automated extraction from over 152,000 peer-reviewed publications collected from 17 leading computer science conferences.
data.annotation: Automatically generated through Large Language Models (LLMs) with validation against human annotations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing automated summaries to human-generated reference summaries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in BLEU and ROUGE indicate better alignment with human summaries.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 outperformed other models in semantic evaluation metrics.
methodology.validation: The dataset's summaries were validated against human annotations to ensure quality.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: None explicitly mentioned in the paper.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential biases introduced by the selection of top-tier conferences in the dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Open Academic Graph (OAG) dataset is publicly released under the ODC-BY license.
